title: Protocol for Life Balance
description: VitaLiving offers Free Shipping on Protocol for Life Balance supplements. Enjoy Vita Rewards discounts on all vitamins, antioxidants, and anti-aging products.
cleaned_text: Protocol for Life Balance N-Acetyl-Cysteine (NAC) is a stable and bioactive form of L-Cysteine, an amino acid that plays a key role in phase II detoxification and homocysteine metabolism. NAC is efficiently transported into the cell, where it is readily converted to cysteine for glutathione synthesis and regeneration. Because NAC can penetrate the blood-brain-barrier, it is especially important for maintaining healthy brain and nervous system tissues. NAC also helps to support respiratory health by promoting normal mucus viscosity.â€¢ Supports Ingredients:Microcrystalline Cellulose, Hydroxypropyl Cellulose, Stearic Acid (vegetable source), Vegetarian Coating, Silicon DioxideTake 1 tablet 1 to 3 times daily, or as directed by your healthcare practitioner.Not manufactured with wheat, gluten, soy, milk, egg, fish, shellfish or tree nut ingredients. Biotic BLIS K12 successfully colonizes the oral cavity at the expense of other microorganisms, thereby promoting oral health. Vitamin K2 more specifically is a significant regulator of tissue calcification and is critical for the maintenance of arterial elasticity and cardiovascular health. Vitamin K2 includes two of the most studied subtypes, MK-7 (Menaquinone-7) and MK-4 (Menatetrenone). MK-7, the most readily absorbed and bioactive form of K2, has no common dietary sources. It is a member of the B-Vitamin family that contributes to muscular and nerve function, and participates in the metabolism of fats in the liver. Myo-Inositol is the most abundant form of this nutrient, with its highest concentrations being found in the brain and central nervous system. Myo-Inositol in particular is a versatile nutrient for the promotion of emotional and mental wellness, healthy eating patterns, and restful sleep through its critical role in neurotransmitter messaging systems.
